title: Japan-South Korea Talks Fail to Thaw Diplomatic Deep Freeze
text:
TOKYO—Japan and South Korea held their first leader-level talks in more than a year but showed no sign of progress in resolving disputes that have sent ties between the two U.S. allies into free fall, including accusations of military threats against each other.

During 20 minutes of talks in Tokyo, South Korean Prime Minister Lee Nak-yon handed Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe a letter from South Korean President Moon Jae-in, and Mr. Abe said the dire state of relations shouldn’t be left unaddressed, according to a Japanese...
description: Japan and South Korea held their first leader-level talks in more than a year but showed no sign of progress in resolving disputes that have sent ties between the two U.S. allies into free fall.
